author: bridge-bot
content: <KamilChNethermind> We had another issue in our scripts and now is solved so data should appear on dashboard soon.

author: bridge-bot
content:
<KamilChNethermind> Need to verify once more some data but this is roughly how repricing affect performance of current modexp scenarios - quite significant difference :)

This is only for nethermind - if any other client wants to do that need to make a "dummy enable" of repricing EIP for Dencun hardfork and provide branch so we can try it out

author: bridge-bot
content: <KamilChNethermind> Slowest at around 92 for now for Nethermind

author: bridge-bot
content:
<notnotstorm_p> re: **@KamilChNethermind**
> Need to verify once more some data but this is roughly how repricing affect performance of current modexp scenarios - quite significant difference :)

This is only for nethermind - if any other client wants to do that need to make a "dummy enable" of repricing EIP for Dencun hardfork and provide branch so we can try it out
can you explain how to interpret the columns of this table

author: bridge-bot
content:
<KamilChNethermind> This is comparison of "slowest vs fastest" and filtered out default "nethermind" vs adjusted "nethermind-modexp"
Whatever is on a left side of table is "slower" and on right side is "faster" and last column shows ratio

author: bridge-bot
content: <KamilChNethermind> So for example slowest Modexp for nethermind was on 23 (before recent improvements which bumps it to around 30) vs 92 after improvement so around 3x better

author: bridge-bot
content:
<KamilChNethermind> And there are scenarios (like very first row) which improves over 27 times (but this doesn't take into account some other improvements made by nethermind that's why i need to fix nethermind data a bit better).

General goal was to check what is the slowest scenario now for nethermind after repricing - and seems like for now is 92 mgas/s

author: bridge-bot
content: <notnotstorm_p> so the column labeled "Max value" is just the benchmarks under the new pricing model, it's not taking the max across multiple conditions?

author: bridge-bot
content: <KamilChNethermind> So you can treat it as "slowest on nethermind default vs slowest on nethermind repriced"

author: bridge-bot
content: <KamilChNethermind> We have also way too much modexp scenarios :D Next week with Marcin we will go through them and will reduce amount to speed up testing as quite a few of them are doing likely similar things with just slightly different params.
